Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Health Insurance, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Covered Expenses Include:
*   Monthly Stipend: Up to 9000 TL per month (specific amounts may vary by study level).
*   Tuition Fee: Full coverage of university tuition fees.
*   Return Flight Ticket: A one-time return flight ticket to Turkey.
*   Health Insurance: Comprehensive health insurance, allowing students to benefit from widespread health services.
*   Accommodation: Provision of accommodation.
*   Turkish Language Course: A mandatory one-year Turkish language course, even if the degree program is taught in English.
Quantity: New awards annually: Around 5,000, Currently supported: Over 15,000 grantees
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students from all nationalities. Awarded to outstanding students. Maintaining a high GPA is a key eligibility factor. Individuals currently enrolled in programs in Turkish universities at the level of education they will apply for are generally not eligible for full-time scholarships. Available for full-time and short-term education opportunities. Maximum age 21 for undergraduate programs, under 30 for master's programs, under 35 for PhD programs, under 50 for Research Scholarship.
Eligible_Fields: Music and performing arts, Fine arts, International Relations, Religion and theology, Journalism and reporting, Architecture and town planning, Language acquisition, Literature and linguistics, Mechanics and metal trades
Eligible_Field_Group: Engineering & Technology, Humanities & Social Sciences, Healthcare & Medicine, Natural Sciences, Arts, Design & Media, Construction & Planning
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Min_Gpa: Undergraduate: 70%, Postgraduate (Master's and PhD): 75% or higher
Experience_Years: No explicit minimum years of general experience are stated for most programs, though research scholarships may implicitly require relevant experience.
Language_Certificate: TOEFL IBT (minimum 75, or 70 for some programs), IELTS, TOEFL PBT, YDS. All scholarship recipients are required to take a one-year Turkish language course before commencing their academic program.
Age: Maximum age 21 for undergraduate programs, Under 30 for master's programs, Under 35 for PhD programs, Under 50 for Research Scholarship
Career_Plan: A compelling statement of purpose is required, articulating academic and career aspirations and emphasizing why the applicant is a good fit for the scholarship program and their chosen field.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must pay attention to academic achievements, language proficiency, and any specific conditions set by the scholarship provider.
Scholarship_Info: The Turkiye Burslari (Turkey Government Scholarship) is a highly prestigious and comprehensive fully funded scholarship program offered by the Government of Turkey to outstanding international students worldwide. It aims to foster academic excellence and cultural exchange by enabling students to pursue full-time or short-term programs at top Turkish universities. It offers international students a transformative opportunity to pursue academic excellence in a culturally rich environment, providing free higher education and a unique life experience at prestigious Turkish universities. The program also aims to strengthen educational and cultural ties between Turkey and other countries.
Application_Documents:
*   National ID Card (CNIC) / Passport
*   Letter(s) of Recommendation
*   Personal Statement / Statement of Purpose
*   Academic transcripts and diplomas
*   Language proficiency certificates (if applicable)
*   Standardized test scores (if applicable)
Applicants need to ensure all documents are up-to-date, accurate, and meet specified requirements.
Timeline:
January 10th annually : Application Opening Date
February 20th annually : Application Deadline
Post-application : Evaluation and Selection Process, including interviews at Turkish embassies or consulates
Post-selection : Mandatory one-year Turkish language course

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
- Travel: An economy class air-ticket to Brunei Darussalam from the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/domicile prior to the commencement of the course, and an economy class air-ticket from Brunei Darussalam to the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/domicile upon completion of the course.
- Tuition Fees: 100% exemption from university tuition fees.
- Living Allowance: A monthly allowance to cover living expenses.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to all international students. International students currently studying or who have previously studied in Brunei tertiary institutions are NOT eligible. Upon completion of the program, the scholarship recipient is required to leave Brunei Darussalam with immediate effect. Scholarship recipients are not permitted to undertake any paid employment or to serve on the staff of any country's representative mission in Brunei Darussalam during the duration of the scholarship.
Min_Gpa: Undergraduate: Five (5) Distinctions (As & Bs) in the Senior Secondary Certificate or equivalent; Master's: Second-Class Honours (Upper Division) Bachelor's degree.
Language_Certificate: Minimum IELTS score of 6.0 or a TOEFL score of 550.
Age: No specific age limits are mentioned.
Gender: No specific gender requirements are mentioned.
Special_Circumstances: No specific provisions for special circumstances are detailed.
Career_Plan: Required. Applicants must submit a Statement of Purpose outlining their academic and career plans, and their motivation for applying for the scholarship.
Other_Requirements:
Reference Letters: Required. Two reference letters assessing the applicant's academic ability are typically requested. These letters should be forwarded to the Technical Assistance Department, Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, Brunei Darussalam (Email: tad.scholarship@mfa.gov.bn).
University-Specific Application: Applicants applying to Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD) must also complete a separate online application through UBD's admission portal in addition to the BDGS application.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship (BDGS) is a prestigious, fully funded award designed for international students seeking to pursue Diploma, Undergraduate, and Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs in Brunei Darussalam. Offered annually under a special scholarship award scheme by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the scholarship aims to foster global understanding by inviting students from various countries to study at leading Bruneian higher education institutions.
Application_Documents:
- Online Application Form (BDGS Application Form)
- Identification card
- Certified academic certificates and transcripts
- Statement of Purpose
- Reference Letters
Timeline: 2026-01-09 : Application Deadline. Note: Applications for the 2025/2026 academic session are currently closed, suggesting this deadline may refer to a future intake or that the application window for the 2025/2026 session has already passed. Specific opening dates are not provided, but applications for the 2025/2026 academic session were announced as open across various platforms.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Tuition Fees: Full coverage of all academic tuition fees.
Monthly Stipend: A monthly stipend of 16,000 Baht is provided to cover living expenses.
Accommodation/Housing: The monthly stipend is also intended to cover accommodation costs.
Round-trip Economy Class Airfare: Reimbursement for an economy class, round-trip air ticket, with the amount varying based on the applicant's home location.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students from both ASEAN and Non-ASEAN countries. Candidates from all around the world are eligible. Applicants must not have been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester prior to applying for this scholarship. Applicants must not be over 35 years of age.
Language_Certificate: TOEFL (500 PBT / 173 CBT) or IELTS, or university certificate of English proficiency
Special_Circumstances: Students who have already been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester are ineligible.
Career_Plan: Required (detailed study plan or description of academic interests)
Other_Requirements: Recipients are strictly prohibited from accepting any off-campus employment in Thailand during the scholarship term. The term of the scholarship cannot be extended beyond its initial period. Recipients are required to reside in Thailand for the duration of their studies. There is no application fee for this scholarship.
Scholarship_Info: The Chulalongkorn University Graduate Scholarship Program for ASEAN or Non-ASEAN Countries is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship offered by Thailand's oldest and most renowned university, Chulalongkorn University, established on March 26, 1917. This program aims to foster academic cooperation and offer comprehensive financial assistance to international students pursuing Master's or Doctoral degrees from ASEAN and Non-ASEAN countries, strengthening academic cooperation between Thailand and the global community.
Application_Documents:
Completed application form (downloadable from http://academic.chula.ac.th).
Curriculum Vitae (CV).
Copy of Certificate of Graduation and an official transcript of academic records.
English proficiency score record (TOEFL, IELTS, or university certificate).
Copy of passport.
Study plan / description of academic interests (on a separate A4-sized paper).
One 1-inch-colored photo (with blue background), taken no more than six months prior, in polite attire, with the applicant's signature on the reverse side.
Two recommendation letters from the Head, Director, or Dean of the applicant's previous institution.
Timeline:
September 2025 : Application Opening
At least two weeks prior to October 13, 2025 : Submit application to Faculty/Program for internal screening
October 13, 2025 : Application Deadline (University’s Office of Academic Affairs)

Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Tuition Fee Coverage: 100% tuition-free education for the entire duration of the program.
Monthly Stipend: For preparatory, bachelor's, and master's programmes: HUF 43,700 (approximately EUR 103) per month, paid for 12 months a year. For doctoral level: HUF 140,000 (approximately EUR 365-390) per month for the first four semesters, and HUF 180,000 (approximately EUR 470-500) per month for the second four semesters, paid for 12 months a year.
Accommodation Contribution: Free dormitory place or a contribution of HUF 40,000 per month towards accommodation costs.
Medical Insurance: Supplementary medical insurance coverage up to HUF 65,000 (approximately EUR 160) annually.
Travel Costs: In some cases, travel costs may also be covered.
Quantity: More than 4900 students (awarded for 2020/2021 academic year)
Eligibility_Criteria: Primarily for foreign students, based on bilateral educational cooperation agreements between Hungary and specific Sending Partner countries. Applicants must be citizens of a Sending Partner country and apply through their country's designated Sending Partner. Eligibility for specific scholarship types and study fields is determined by these bilateral agreements. Self-financed students currently enrolled in a Hungarian Higher Education Institution are only eligible to apply under specific conditions, particularly if applying for the same study level. For continued state-funded support, scholarship holders must successfully complete at least their first semester of studies and demonstrate high academic performance. A dedicated 'Students at Risk Subprogramme' is also available for eligible applicants. Pakistani nationals are required to submit a bond to the Higher Education Commission (HEC) stating they will not change their discipline after the final award and will return to Pakistan to serve the country immediately after completing their degree.
Eligible_Fields: Agricultural/Biosystems Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Education science, Fine arts, Law, Management and administration, Medicine, Political sciences and civics, Public Health, Psychology, Sociology and cultural studies, Sports, Teacher training with subject specialisation, Training for pre-school teachers
Eligible_Field_Group: Agriculture & Environment, Arts, Design & Media, Economics & Business, Education & Training, Engineering & Technology, Healthcare & Medicine, Humanities & Social Sciences, IT & Data Science, Law & Public Policy, Natural Sciences, Personal Services & Tourism, Social Services & Care
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Bachelor's equivalent, Master's degree, Master's equivalent
Min_Gpa: 56/100 for application acceptance; 4/5 for continued state-funded support
Experience_Years: Not universally specified; scientific or technological research production highly valued for PhD applicants (e.g., published articles, book chapters, project coordination).
Min_Working_Hours: Not more than 30 hours a week during teaching period; full-time for maximum 90 days a year outside teaching period.
Language_Certificate: IELTS (overall 5.0 or higher, valid for 2 years), TOEFL iBT (87-109), TOEIC Listening and Reading (785), TOEIC Speaking and Writing (310), Michigan ECCE, PTE General Level 3, PTE Academic (59), Cambridge Certificate (for Brazil PhD). Proof of previous studies in the language of the selected program also accepted.
Special_Circumstances: Self-financed students currently enrolled in a Hungarian Higher Education Institution are only eligible to apply for the Stipendium Hungaricum programme under specific conditions, particularly if they are applying for the same study level. 'Students at Risk Subprogramme' is also available for eligible applicants. Pakistani nationals are required to submit a bond to the Higher Education Commission (HEC).
Career_Plan: A well-crafted personal essay or motivation letter is crucial. PhD applicants must also submit a Research Plan (minimum 2 pages, Times New Roman 12-point font, in study program language). A Letter of Intent is also generally required.
Other_Requirements:
Reference Letters: Recommendation from an employer or a former dean/professor. For doctoral programs, a letter of recommendation/support from a professor at the prospective host Hungarian institution may also be required.
Document Translation: All documents not in the language of the selected study programme or Hungarian must be translated and submitted along with the original copies.
Supervisor's Statement (PhD): If required by the doctoral program, an acceptance statement from a supervisor must be attached to the application.
Partial (Exchange) Study Programmes: Scanned copy of original certificate about student status, issued by the current higher education institution, and its translation are required.
Country-Specific Application Portals: Pakistani nationals must submit online applications via both the Hungarian scholarship portal and the HEC website.
Internship Opportunities: Scholarship holders are entitled, and often required, to participate in internship opportunities as a prerequisite for their last semester before graduating.
Scholarship_Info: The Stipendium Hungaricum is a prestigious Hungarian Government Scholarship program designed for foreign students. Launched in 2013 to promote the internationalization of Hungarian higher education and attract top international students. It is provided by the Hungarian Government, managed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, and coordinated by the Tempus Public Foundation. The program facilitates studies in Hungary, fostering personal and professional attachments to the country while offering high-quality education. It is based on bilateral educational agreements and has consistently attracted a growing number of international students, establishing Hungary as a popular destination for higher education. The program also supports scholarship holders through a Mentor Network and the Alumni Hungary Network, which provides internship opportunities and fosters connections.
Application_Documents:
Online application form (completed on apply.stipendiumhungaricum.hu)
Letter of Intent
Motivation Letter/Personal Essay
Recommendation from employer or former dean/professor
Letter of recommendation/support from a professor of the host Hungarian institution (if applicable)
Research Plan (for PhD applicants, minimum 2 pages, Times New Roman 12pt, in study program language)
Updated curriculum vitae (e.g., from Lattes Platform for Brazil PhD applicants)
Academic Transcripts and Diplomas: HSSC/Intermediate or equivalent (for Bachelor's/One-Tier), 16 years Bachelor's degree or equivalent (for Master's), 17/18 years Degree/or equivalent (for PhD), Undergraduate diploma (recognized by MEC for Brazil PhD), Master’s diploma (optional for Brazil PhD). Final degree and transcript must be submitted before August 01, 2025.
Language proficiency test results (IELTS, TOEFL, Cambridge Certificate, PTE, TOEIC, Michigan ECCE) or proof of previous studies in the language of the selected program.
Scanned copy of original certificate about student status and its translation (for partial/exchange programs).
Supervisor's statement (if required for PhD).
Translations of all documents not in the language of the selected study program or Hungarian.
Timeline:
15 March 2024 : Supervisor's Statement (PhD) submission deadline (if required)
Mid-November 2024 : Online Application System Opening for 2025/2026 academic year
15 January 2025 : Application Deadline
February 2025 : Nomination by Sending Partners
June 2025 : Final Results Announcement
August 01, 2025 : Final degree certificates and transcripts submission deadline
September 2025 : Commencement of Studies in Hungary

Scholarship_Name: Danish Government Scholarship (University of Southern Denmark – SDU)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Partial Funding, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Danish Government Scholarship is a fully or partially funded award.
*   Full Tuition Fee Waiver: The scholarship primarily covers the full tuition fees for the duration of the Master's program.
*   Partial Tuition Fee Waiver: In some cases, a partial tuition fee waiver may be granted, covering tuition for one year (typically the second and fourth semesters), requiring the student to pay for the first and third semesters.
*   Monthly Living Expenses Grant: Recipients receive a monthly stipend of DKK 3000 (before taxes) to cover living costs.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be a non-EU/EEA citizen and eligible to pay tuition fees in Denmark. They must be highly qualified and demonstrate strong academic performance. Enrollment in specific Master’s degree programs at SDU is required. Some sources indicate a preference for citizens of developing countries. Outstanding international students committed to social impact and leadership are particularly sought after. Applicants must first complete and submit the online admission application for their chosen Master’s program at SDU; a separate scholarship application is generally not required as eligible candidates are automatically considered based on their admission application. Incomplete or late applications for admission will not be eligible for the scholarship.
Experience_Years: Applicants may benefit from having at least one year of work experience within the last three years.
Language_Certificate:
English proficiency is a mandatory requirement for admission to English-taught programs. This can be demonstrated through various means:
*   TOEFL: A minimum score of 575 (paper-based), 230 (computer-based), or 88 (internet-based) is required.
*   Danish High School English: Passing English B from a Danish High School with a minimum grade of 2.0 on the Danish 7-point grading scale.
*   English A (or equivalent): Required for admission to the English Studies program.
*   General English Subject: English as a subject must be passed with a grade equivalent to a minimum of 2.0 on the Danish 7-point grading scale.
Other_Requirements: Strong recommendation letters from professors or employers who can vouch for the applicant's abilities and character are highly beneficial. Applicants should demonstrate a commitment to social impact and leadership. Scholarships can only be awarded for programs offered on SDU's campus in Vejle.
Scholarship_Info: The Danish Government Scholarship at the University of Southern Denmark (SDU) is a prestigious, fully or partially funded opportunity for highly qualified international students from non-EU/EEA countries, provided by the Ministry of Higher Education and Science. It aims to support outstanding students pursuing specific Master's degree programs at SDU, acknowledging their significant investment in education. SDU is recognized as one of the world's top 50 universities (according to QS World Ranking) and is known for its dynamic academic environment, career networking events, internships, and project-based courses, boasting a 70% placement rate. The scholarship is highly competitive due to a limited number of awards.
Application_Documents: The main application document is the online admission application for the chosen Master’s program at SDU. No separate scholarship application form is needed. Strong recommendation letters from professors or employers are highly beneficial.
Timeline:
Not explicitly specified : Opening Date
2025-10-15 : Application Deadline for February Intake
2026-01-07 : Application Deadline for September Intake
International students are advised to apply earlier than EU/EEA students to allow sufficient time (up to three months) to obtain a residence permit.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Stipend, Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The CGS is a comprehensive scholarship, covering a wide range of expenses. The annual funding for undergraduates ranges from 59,200 yuan to 66,200 yuan, depending on the category, while master's (general scholar) programs also receive annual funding. The AASCU-designated Chinese Government Scholarship is valued at approximately 10,000 USD, which is disbursed directly to the Chinese universities rather than to individual students.

Covered expenses typically include:
*   Free registration and tuition fees
*   Free accommodation
*   Stipend
*   Medical insurance
*   Emergent medical care
*   One-time only settlement
*   Education costs
*   Administration costs
*   Expenditures to support student activities
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be a citizen of a country other than the People's Republic of China. Must be in good health, both mentally and physically. Applicants must not have finished their previous study within China, or it must have been at least one year since they completed their previous study in China. Awardees may not concurrently hold overlapping Chinese government-funded scholarships. While the program is generally open to all nationalities, the 'Silk Road' program specifically requires applicants to be nationals of countries that belong to the ‘One Belt One Road’ initiative.
Eligible_Field_Group: Healthcare & Medicine, Economics & Business, Law & Public Policy, Humanities & Social Sciences, Natural Sciences, Engineering & Technology, Agriculture & Environment
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: No specific minimum years of professional experience are universally required
Language_Certificate: For Chinese-Taught Programs (Direct Entry): HSK Level 5 or above with a minimum score of 180. For 'Silk Road' Program: Bachelor’s applicants need HSK 3 (minimum 180); Master’s and Ph.D. applicants for Chinese-taught programs need HSK 4 (minimum 180). Those who meet minimum HSK but not direct major entry proficiency may get one year of Chinese language study. No Chinese proficiency requirements for general scholar applicants studying Chinese language programs. HSK Winner Scholarship available for students with good HSK scores majoring in Chinese language.
Age: Under 35 for Master's program applicants, Under 40 for HSK winner scholarship applicants
Special_Circumstances: Applicants for postgraduate programs or academic education as a general or senior scholar should provide admission documents (admission letter, pre-admission letter, or invitation letter from a prospective supervisor) from their preferred university, which serve as a priority for admission. Applicants planning to stay in China for more than 6 months must submit a photocopy of the Foreigner Physical Examination Form, completed in English. Some embassies or application channels require an 'Agency Number' (e.g., '5831' was mentioned for one embassy). Applicants are advised to research designated Chinese universities and the majors they offer via websites like www.campuschina.org to identify their preferred scholarship program, university, and major. For the AASCU-designated CGS, applying to AASCU recommended Chinese partner universities is encouraged.
Other_Requirements: Applicants for graduate programs or senior scholar programs must submit two letters of recommendation in Chinese or English from professors or associate professors. A Study Plan or Research Proposal is required, in either English or Chinese, with minimum word counts: Undergraduate: 200 words; Master's: 800 words; PhD: 800 words.
Scholarship_Info: The Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS) is a prestigious program designed to enable outstanding students, teachers, and scholars from around the world to pursue studies and conduct research in China. It is primarily provided by the Chinese Government, specifically through the Ministry of Education of China and administered by the Chinese Scholarship Council (CSC). Embassies and Consulates of the People’s Republic of China also play a crucial role in the application process. Additionally, specific programs like the AASCU-designated Chinese Government Scholarship are administered by organizations such as the American Association of State Colleges and Universities (AASCU) in collaboration with the Chinese Embassy. The scholarship supports study in China across various academic levels and is a full academic-year scholarship supporting undergraduate, master’s, and PhD studies.
Application_Documents:
Completed Application Form for Chinese Government Scholarship (submitted online via CGSIS).
Copy of the submitted online application.
Valid HSK score report (if applicable).
Two letters of recommendation.
Study Plan or Research Proposal.
Pre-admission document issued by the universities (if applicable).
Photocopy of the Foreigner Physical Examination Form (if staying over 6 months).
Other supporting documentation as required by the specific program or university.
Timeline:
Application period for 2026/2027 academic year is now open.
2026-02-08 : Primary Online Application Deadline (CGSIS)
2026-02-25 : Ireland Applicants email submission deadline (5pm GMT)
2026-02-28 : Zhejiang University (Youth of Excellence Scheme of China Program) email submission deadline
June or July : Admission letters typically issued by the Chinese Ministry of Education and the host Chinese university

Scholarship_Name: Government of Ireland – International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES)
Funding_Details:
Successful awardees receive:
*   Full Tuition Fee Waiver: The scholarship covers the full tuition fees for the academic year.
*   €10,000 Stipend: A generous stipend of €10,000 is provided for one year of full-time study. This stipend is typically disbursed monthly and is intended to support student costs and living expenses in Ireland.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be citizens from non-EU/EEA countries, including individuals with a domiciliary of origin outside the EU/EEA, Switzerland, and the United Kingdom. Examples often cited include Nigeria, South Africa, Zambia, Burundi, Namibia, and Angola. Candidates must be applying for a Master’s, Postgraduate Diploma, or Doctoral Scholarship (NFQ levels 9 or 10). A conditional or final offer of admission to an eligible Irish higher education institution for a full-time program at NFQ levels 9 or 10 is required at the time of applying for the scholarship. Applicants must submit a copy of this offer. For research master’s applicants: Must not currently hold, or have previously held, a Council Postgraduate Scholarship. For PhD applicants: Must not currently hold, or have previously held, any Council Postgraduate Scholarship other than those which would enable them to obtain a research master’s degree. Applicants must not have previously received a GOI-IES scholarship. Applicants are expected to demonstrate academic excellence, leadership potential, and a commitment to global engagement, with the potential to be future leaders in their field and make a significant difference in the world.
Experience_Years: Not explicitly prescribed, but prior experience, whether academic, professional, or volunteer, can be a significant factor in demonstrating leadership potential and commitment to global engagement, which are key assessment criteria.
Language_Certificate: Required (IELTS, DET, TOEFL, PTE or equivalent, specific scores depend on HEI/program)
Career_Plan: Demonstrate potential to be future leaders in their field and commitment to making a difference in the world; align scholarship with future aspirations.
Other_Requirements: A carefully prepared application that clearly articulates academic achievements, future aspirations, and how the scholarship aligns with the applicant's goals is essential.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Ireland – International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES) is a prestigious and highly competitive program designed to attract top-tier international students to Ireland. Funded by the Government of Ireland in partnership with Irish higher education institutions (HEIs) and managed by the Higher Education Authority (HEA), this scholarship serves as the country's flagship funding offer for international students. It aims to support high-calibre individuals who demonstrate academic excellence, leadership potential, and a commitment to global engagement, with the potential to be future leaders in their field and make a significant difference in the world.
Application_Documents:
Academic Transcripts
Recommendation Letters/References
Personal Statement / Statement of Purpose
Essays/Personal Insights
Conditional or Final Offer of Admission from an eligible Irish HEI
Proof of nationality/domiciliary of origin
Timeline:
Currently open : Applications for 2025/26 academic year
2025-03-05 : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Beca Colombia scholarship is fully funded, offering comprehensive financial support to selected international students. The benefits provided include:
*   Full Tuition Coverage: Complete coverage of tuition fees for the chosen academic program.
*   Monthly Stipend: A monthly stipend of one million six hundred thousand (1,600,000) Colombian pesos (approximately 828 USD in 2024) to cover basic living expenses.
*   Health Insurance: Comprehensive health insurance and coverage for medical costs.
*   Visa Expenses/Support: Assistance with visa application processes and associated expenses.
*   Installation Expenses: Financial support for initial installation costs.
*   Books/Book Allowance: An allowance for books and study materials.
*   Travel Allowance: Coverage for travel-related expenses.
*   Family Allowance: (Specific details not provided, but listed as a benefit).
*   Rent: (Specific details not provided, but listed as a benefit).
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be foreign citizens from any nationality, excluding Colombian nationals/citizens or permanent residents of Colombia. Individuals with dual nationality (Colombian) are also ineligible. Applicants must not be residing, nor have resided, in Colombian territory for the last six months prior to applying for the scholarship. They must also not have started studies in Colombia at the time of application. The scholarship targets high-achieving international students with exceptional academic merit and leadership potential. Candidates must not have been beneficiaries of this program in previous calls. Applicants must have a minimum income equivalent to three minimum wages, which was approximately 3,480,000 COP (828 USD) in 2024.
Experience_Years: A minimum of one (1) year of professional experience is required.
Language_Certificate: Language requirements mentioned, but no specific tests/scores provided.
Special_Circumstances: Scholarship recipients must agree not to request a visa to remain in Colombia for two (2) years from the date the scholarship ends. The purpose of the scholarship is for foreign students to acquire knowledge in Colombia and then return to their country of origin or residence to apply that knowledge.
Other_Requirements: A recent academic letter of recommendation is required from a university professor who taught the applicant during their bachelor's degree. This letter must be dated within thirty days of the application date. No application fee is required.
Scholarship_Info: The Colombia Government Scholarship, officially known as "Beca Colombia," is a fully funded scholarship program provided by the Government of Colombia through ICETEX. This initiative aims to promote higher education and international cooperation by offering educational opportunities to foreign citizens within the framework of the Strategy of Reciprocity for foreigners. The scholarship targets high-achieving international students with exceptional academic merit and leadership potential who wish to pursue postgraduate studies in Colombia. Administered by ICETEX, the scholarship is a key component of Colombia's strategy of reciprocity for foreigners, aiming to attract and support high-achieving international students in pursuing postgraduate studies within Colombian higher education institutions.
Application_Documents:
*   Online application form.
*   Verified copies of educational transcripts.
*   University certificate-transcript (in English or Spanish) certifying the applicant's GPA.
*   Academic letter of reference (as specified above).
Timeline:
Currently open : Applications for 2025/2026 and 2026/2027 academic years
2025-06-13 : Application Deadline for 2025-2026 academic year
June - August 2026 : Final Selection
July 1 - November 1, 2026 : Scholarship Commencement
2024 : 81 scholarships granted

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details: A grant of €10,000 or €10,020 is provided per academic year to cover living expenses. A full tuition fee waiver is included, meaning scholarship recipients do not pay tuition fees to their host institution. Covered expenses include tuition fees and living expenses (via the grant).
Eligibility_Criteria: Outstanding international students from all over the world applying for a Master's degree program. Applicants must apply to and be accepted by one of the participating Flemish higher education institutions in Flanders and Brussels. Acceptance by the host institution for a degree program is mandatory to receive the scholarship. Students whose previous degree (which they used to enroll for the Master's program) was obtained at a Flemish higher education institution are NOT eligible. Students who are already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution cannot apply. International students who have previously been enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution on credit mobility (such as Erasmus+) ARE still eligible for a Master Mind Scholarship.
Language_Certificate: IELTS: An overall minimum band score of 7.0, TOEFL: A minimum total score of 94, Common European Framework: A C1 level
Special_Circumstances: Students whose previous degree (which they used to enroll for the Master's program) was obtained at a Flemish higher education institution are NOT eligible. Students who are already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution cannot apply. International students who have previously been enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution on credit mobility (such as Erasmus+) ARE still eligible for a Master Mind Scholarship. Preparatory programs and distance learning programs are NOT eligible for the Master Mind Scholarship.
Career_Plan: A motivation letter is typically required for university admission and is often where applicants articulate their enthusiasm for the program and their career goals.
Other_Requirements: Resume/CV is required as part of the application. Acceptance by the host institution for a degree program is mandatory to receive the scholarship, even if the acceptance decision is made after the initial scholarship selection.
Scholarship_Info: The Master Mind Scholarship offers an exceptional opportunity for outstanding international students worldwide to pursue a Master’s degree in Flanders and Brussels, Belgium. It aims to attract talented individuals to Flemish higher education institutions.
Application_Documents:
Master Mind Scholarship Application Form (mandatory, often completed as part of the university's internal nomination process).
KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (if applying to KU Leuven).
Resume/CV.
Official letter of acceptance from the host university (required before final scholarship award).
Motivation Letter (implied, often part of university application, discussing academic and career goals).
Proof of English language proficiency (IELTS, TOEFL, or C1 certificate).
Academic transcripts and degree certificates (for university admission).
Timeline:
Academic Years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027 : Scholarship available
Annually (well in advance of university deadline) : Applications typically open
2025-01-15 : University Application Deadline (for 2025-2026 academic year)
2025-03-15 : Master Mind application form deadline (for 2026-2027 academic year, may refer to internal university deadline)
2026-01-15 : University Application Deadline (for 2026-2027 academic year)
Following university application deadline : Host institutions nominate eligible students
After nomination : Host institution initiates application procedure by creating candidate’s application file in Mobility-Online tool
After file creation : Pre-selected candidates receive email generated by Mobility-Online tool
Before formal scholarship award : Official letter of acceptance issued by the host university's Education and Student Administration Office is needed

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Tuition Waiver, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Grantees typically receive a monthly stipend of approximately €900, which is usually paid on a quarterly basis. While some sources mention a total of 9000 euros for a full year, the grants are specifically offered for durations of 9 months (renewable for multi-year courses) or 3 months (exclusively for advanced Italian language and culture courses).
Covered expenses include:
*   Exemption from Payment of enrollment and tuition fees at public or legally recognized Italian educational institutions.
*   Health and Medical/Accident insurance coverage.
*   Living expenses, supported by the monthly stipend.
The grant is incompatible with any other scholarship or financial aid offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including DSU grants.
Quantity: A fixed number of fully funded scholarships are awarded annually. Specific mentions include a maximum of 9 scholarships/grants for six months (900€ each month) from certain embassies, alongside the general offering of 9-month and 3-month scholarships.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to foreign citizens living abroad and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Applicants must not be residing in Italy at the time of application. Must hold an appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in the chosen Italian University or Institute. The grant is incompatible with any other grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including DSU grants. Generally excludes Bachelor's degree programs (with the exception of AFAM programs) and Single-cycle degree programs (“Lauree magistrali a ciclo unico”).
Eligible_Fields: Fine arts, Music and performing arts, Language acquisition
Eligible_Field_Group: Arts, Design & Media, Humanities & Social Sciences, Natural Sciences, Engineering & Technology, IT & Data Science, Economics & Business
Language_Certificate: Italian B2 CEFR for Italian-taught programs (or university language teacher certification); English proficiency certificate for English-taught programs; Italian A2 CEFR for Italian Language and Culture advanced courses.
Age: Max 28 for Master’s Degree programs, Higher Education for Fine Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) programs, or Italian Language and Culture advanced courses (born after May 16, 1996); Max 30 for PhD programs; Max 40 for Research under academic supervision.
Special_Circumstances: Some scholarship allocations may have specific conditions; for instance, certain scholarships are open exclusively to Palestinian citizens.
Career_Plan: Applicants are advised to write about their personal story, academic interests, study path, and the purpose and objectives of their study project. This is a crucial component for demonstrating motivation.
Other_Requirements: Academic merit is a key selection criterion; PhD candidates require a letter of acceptance from an Italian University.
Scholarship_Info: The Italian Government Scholarship, officially known as the MAECI Scholarship, is an esteemed initiative provided by the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI). This scholarship is designed to support international students in pursuing higher education, research, and language training in Italy. It aims to foster international cooperation in cultural, scientific, and technological fields, promote the Italian language and culture globally, and support Italy’s economic system. The MAECI Scholarship is a prestigious opportunity for international students to immerse themselves in Italy’s rich academic and cultural heritage, fostering global understanding and academic excellence.
Application_Documents: Academic qualifications; Italian/English language proficiency certificates; Letter of Acceptance (for PhD applicants); Career Plan/Motivation Letter.
Timeline: 2025-05-16 : Application Deadline; 2025-11-01 : Academic Year Start (most programs); 2025-11-01 to 2026-07-31 : 9-month scholarship duration; 2026-01-01 : Language courses start; 2026-01-01 to 2026-09-30 : 3-month scholarship duration for advanced Italian language and culture courses.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
TIPP offers fully funded Master’s scholarships, providing 100% tuition coverage, monthly living allowances, and research funding. The program ensures full funding with stipends for outstanding international candidates.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition fees
*   Monthly living allowances
*   Living expenses
*   Research funding and support
*   Stipends
Exclusions: Awardees are responsible for all costs associated with visa applications, including visa fees, travel expenses to the Royal Thai Embassy/Consulate, postal fees (if applicable), and any transit visa fees required.
Eligibility_Criteria: Candidates must fulfill all specified requirements. The program is open to international students from developing countries. A crucial criterion is that candidates must be nominated by their National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation (such as the Ministry of Foreign Affairs) or by relevant central government agencies for which the nominated candidates currently work. Scholarships are allocated for specific member states, and a comprehensive list of eligible countries/territories is made available by TICA for each application cycle. The program primarily targets government officials from eligible developing countries.
Eligible_Fields: Food Science, Biology, Nursing and midwifery, Pharmaceutical Science, Public Health, Crop and livestock production, Environmental sciences, Climate Change Adaptation, Climate Change Mitigation
Eligible_Field_Group: Agriculture & Environment, Healthcare & Medicine, Natural Sciences, Law & Public Policy, Economics & Business, Humanities & Social Sciences, Engineering & Technology
Experience_Years: minimum of 2 years of work experience with the nominating agency
Language_Certificate: English test score, such as TOEFL or IELTS
Age: no more than 45 years of age
Special_Circumstances: The program primarily targets government officials from eligible developing countries.
Other_Requirements: A minimum of three (3) recommendation letters from three different persons are required. Applicants must possess relevant qualification requirements and be engaged in relevant current work. A thesis proposal or other specific documents may be requested by the chosen university.
Scholarship_Info: The Thailand International Postgraduate Programme (TIPP) is a prestigious scholarship initiative provided by the Government of Thailand through the Thailand International Cooperation Agency (TICA). Established in 2000, TIPP operates as a key framework under Thailand International Development Cooperation (TIDC). Its primary objective is to foster sustainable development by sharing Thailand's best practices and expertise with the global community, offering fully funded postgraduate scholarships to individuals from other developing countries who wish to pursue Master's degrees in Thailand.
Application_Documents:
TIPP application form (hard copy required)
Three recommendation letters
English test score (TOEFL/IELTS)
Thesis proposal or other documents as requested by the university
Relevant qualification documents
Timeline:
Several months prior to deadline : Applications Open
2022-05-20 : Application Deadline
2023-07-14 : Application Deadline (St. Lucia applicants)
2023-07-24 : Application Deadline (Kiribati applicants)
2025-01-31 : Application Deadline (submission to Royal Thai Embassy/Permanent Mission/Consulate-General)
2026-01-31 : Application Deadline
Mid-2026 : Program Start/Intake (exact month varies by host university)
2-3 years : Program Duration

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Partial Funding, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
First Prize for Master's (Fully Funded):
*   Tuition Fees: 30,000 RMB per academic year.
*   Living Allowance/Stipend: 1,700 RMB per month for 10 months of the academic year.
*   Medical Insurance: 800 RMB.
*   Accommodation: Included as part of the fully funded package.

Second Prize for Master's (Partial Scholarship):
*   Tuition Fees: 30,000 RMB per academic year.
*   Registration Fee: Also covered under some partial scholarship descriptions.
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be a non-Chinese citizen; Must be in good physical and mental health; Open to both prospective international students and current international students normally enrolled in Tianjin (current students must be foreign self-funded undergraduate, postgraduate, or PhD students); Must meet the language requirements of their chosen higher education institution and provide relevant proofs; Master's applicants must be under 35 years of age.
Language_Certificate: HSK-5 (min 180) for Chinese-instructed programs (HSK-4 min 180 for School of International Education at Tianjin University); English Proficiency Certificates for English-instructed programs (IELTS not strictly required).
Other_Requirements: Two letters of recommendation from professors or associate professors (in Chinese or English); Personal statement/study plan (no less than 800 words for Master's/Doctoral degrees, including personal background, financial situation, personal strengths); Foreigner Physical Examination Form; Admitted students at Tianjin University may be required to pre-pay a deposit of 7,000 RMB and an application fee of 420 RMB; Upon registration, scholarship winners must present original high school certificates and submit diploma copies certified by high school or certificate authorities for enrollment qualification review.
Scholarship_Info: The Tianjin Government Scholarship (Master) is a prestigious award provided by the Tianjin Government in China, designed to attract and support outstanding international students pursuing higher education. It is open to non-Chinese citizens who wish to study at eligible higher education institutions within Tianjin. The scholarship is a one-year award, renewable annually, allowing students to potentially cover the full duration of their Master's program (typically 2-3 years). It is open to both prospective students applying for admission and current international students already enrolled at Tianjin University.
Application_Documents:
Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form (usually completed via an online application system).
Personal Statement (including study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, personal strengths, etc., no less than 800 words for Master's degree, in Chinese or English).
HSK-5 certificate (minimum score 180) for Chinese-instructed programs, or HSK-4 certificate (minimum score 180) for programs in the School of International Education.
English Proficiency Certificates for English-instructed programs (if applicable).
Two letters of recommendation from professors or associate professors (for graduate programs).
Study Experience Resume.
Foreigner Physical Examination Form.
Bachelor's degree certificate and academic transcripts.
Personal passport copy.
Timeline:
October 15, 2024 : Application Opening Date (for 2025 intake at Tianjin University)
May 31, 2025 : Application Deadline (for 2025 intake at Tianjin University)
July 1 - August 31 : Result Announcement, Admission Notice and Visa Application Form (JW202) issuance
2020 intake : 173 applicants awarded

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
*   **Tuition Fees:** Full coverage for the chosen study program.
*   **Accommodation:** Free accommodation in student dormitories.
*   **Living Expenses:** A monthly stipend of up to 80 euros is provided.
*   **Preparatory Year Stipend:** A monthly stipend is also provided for students undertaking the mandatory Romanian language preparatory year.
Eligibility_Criteria: The scholarship targets outstanding students from non-EU countries, though some exceptions may apply for EU candidates. Applicants must demonstrate strong academic results, with an average score for the last graduated school of at least 7 (seven) corresponding to the Romanian scoring system, or a "Good" score. All required documents must be submitted accurately and on time.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Language_Certificate: For Bachelor's and Master's programs, only study programs taught in Romanian are available; a mandatory preparatory year in Romanian is granted for those who do not speak the language. For PhD programs, students may study in Romanian, English, or another language as determined by the university. For programs taught in a language other than Romanian (primarily PhD), applicants must prove proficiency in the language of instruction through recognized language certificates such as TOEFL, IELTS, DELF, or CEFR.
Age: Bachelor's and Master's programs: Under 35 years old, PhD programs: Under 45 years old
Special_Circumstances: Candidates must be citizens from non-EU countries, though some exceptions may apply for EU candidates.
Career_Plan: A motivation letter or statement of purpose is mandatory. This document should clearly explain the applicant’s reasons for applying to the scholarship program, their academic and career goals, and how the scholarship aligns with their aspirations. For PhD applicants, a statement of purpose or letter of intent is specifically mentioned.
Other_Requirements: Specific fields are excluded from this scholarship, namely Medicine, Dental Medicine, and Pharmacy. Master's applicants are typically required to submit two reference letters. Letters of recommendation are generally expected.
Scholarship_Info: The Romanian Government Scholarship (MFA/Study in Romania) is an annual, fully funded scholarship program for foreign citizens, offered by the Romanian state through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Education. Its primary goal is to promote education and cultural exchange by providing opportunities for international students to pursue higher education in Romania at accredited institutions. The program is a key initiative to foster international educational and cultural exchange.
Application_Documents:
The application process is entirely online. Required documents must be uploaded with authorized translations into Romanian, English, French, or Spanish. A comprehensive list of documents includes:
*   Online application form.
*   Diplomas (high school, Bachelor’s, Master’s, PhD if applicable).
*   Transcripts of academic records (including for the final year of studies until application submission).
*   Birth certificate.
*   Passport copy.
*   Curriculum Vitae (Europass format is recommended).
*   Motivation letter/statement of purpose.
*   Medical certificate.
*   Educational certificates (SSC, HSC, Bachelor’s, Master’s, PhD if applicable).
Timeline: 29 January 2025 : Applications open, 12 March 2025 : Application Deadline

Funding_Details:
Recipients benefit from comprehensive coverage of various expenses throughout their study period.
*   Monthly Living Allowance: Provided upon arrival in Indonesia for the duration of the scholarship, including during the BIPA (Bahasa Indonesia for Foreign Speakers) and academic programs.
*   Monthly Research and Book Allowance: Also provided upon arrival in Indonesia for the duration of the scholarship, covering both BIPA and academic programs.
*   No Application Fee: Applicants are not required to pay any application fees.
Quantity: For the 2025 intake, 250 recipients are expected. Since its inception in 2008, the scholarship has been disbursed to 1,290 recipients. In 2021, awardees included 25 Doctoral (S3) students, 218 Master’s (S2) students, and 25 Bachelor’s (S1) program recipients.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must originate from developing countries or countries that maintain strong diplomatic ties with Indonesia. The scholarship is open to prospective international students seeking Bachelor's, Master's, or Doctorate degrees.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: No minimum years of work experience are explicitly stated as a general requirement.
Language_Certificate: TOEFL ITP: 500, TOEFL IBT: 61, IELTS: 6.0, TOEIC: 575
Age: Bachelor's Degree: Maximum 21 years old (no more than December 31st, 2025), Master's/Doctoral Degree: Maximum 40 years old
Career_Plan: For Doctoral applicants, a "Statement of purpose of their studies in Indonesia" is required, which often outlines academic and career aspirations.
Other_Requirements: Valid passport (with at least 2 years of validity), Formal Photo, Curriculum Vitae, Applicants cannot register without a recommendation letter from the Indonesian Representative in the relevant country, Submission of an Offering Letter from a partner university.
Scholarship_Info: The Kemitraan Negara Berkembang (KNB) Scholarship is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program offered by the Government of the Republic of Indonesia for selected international students from developing countries and nations with strong diplomatic ties to Indonesia. It facilitates Bachelor's, Master's, or Doctoral degrees at top Indonesian universities, providing world-class education and cultural immersion. The program is a key component of Indonesia’s global cooperation efforts within the South–South Partnership. It offers an experience of studying in prestigious universities in Indonesia, providing access to quality degree programs managed by 31 to 34 university partners across the country, including institutions like Universitas Brawijaya, ITS Surabaya, Universitas Airlangga, University of Indonesia, and Indonesia University of Education. Students gain exposure to a diverse and vibrant society and an education system that encourages critical thinking and innovation.
Application_Documents: Recommendation letter from Indonesian Embassy/Consulate General, Recommendation letter from potential research supervisor (for Doctoral applicants), Recommendation letter from employer/immediate supervisor (if working), Academic Recommendation Letter from Previous Schools/Universities, Valid passport, Academic transcripts from previous degrees, Scanned degree certificate from previous degrees, Formal Photo, Curriculum Vitae, Offering Letter from a partner university, English Proficiency Test certificate, Statement of purpose of their studies in Indonesia (for Doctoral applicants only).
Timeline: Applications generally open for upcoming academic years (AY 2025, 2025-2026, 2026-2027) : Application Opening, 2025-03-07 : Application Deadline (for 2025-2026 academic year), Post-deadline : Selection results announced online via KNB Scholarship Website and Indonesian Embassy publication network, Ongoing : Monitoring and evaluation processes for all scholarship recipients.

Scholarship_Name: National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic (NSP)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Travel Grant, Accommodation, Tuition Waiver, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Key benefits include:
*   Monthly Stipend: Scholarship holders receive a monthly stipend ranging from €620 to €1,470, depending on their academic level and category.
*   Travel Grant: A flat rate travel grant of up to €1,500 is provided to cover travel costs.
*   Living Costs: The scholarship covers essential living expenses, including accommodation and board.
*   Tuition-Free Stay: The scholarship ensures a tuition-free stay at Slovak host institutions.
*   No Application Fee: There is no application fee required for the program.
Quantity: 146 individuals (one specific call), 48 scholarships annually (ODA nations)
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international nationals (excluding citizens of Slovakia) who are currently studying or working outside Slovakia. Eligible Candidates: Master’s students, PhD students, University teachers, Researchers, and Artists. Specific Requirements for PhD Students: Their higher education or scientific training must take place outside Slovakia; they must be accepted by a public, private, or state university or a research institution in Slovakia (e.g., the Slovak Academy of Sciences) that is eligible to carry out a doctoral study program, for an academic mobility stay to study, conduct research, or engage in artistic activities. General Conditions: Applicants must be admitted or invited to a Slovak host institution for a short-term academic, research, teaching, or artistic stay. International applicants should not have previously studied for a full degree in Slovakia. Ineligibility Conditions: Applicants are not eligible if they meet any of the following criteria: Are accepted for full degree higher education (bachelor, master, or doctoral studies) in Slovakia, or are already studying a full degree in Slovakia and seeking NSP funding for those studies; Are university teachers, researchers, or artists without a PhD degree (or its equivalent) AND have more than 4 years of work experience in these roles (PhD studies are considered work experience); Have spent 15 or more months in the territory of the Slovak Republic within the 36 months prior to the application deadline; Are accepted for a scholarship stay in Slovakia through other public-funded scholarship programs (e.g., International Visegrad Fund, Erasmus+, CEEPUS, bilateral agreements).
Language_Certificate: English Proficiency: IELTS 6.0+, TOEFL iBT 80+ (or Slovak proficiency)
Special_Circumstances: 48 scholarships are annually awarded to students from ODA (Official Development Assistance) nations.
Career_Plan: A detailed study program (for students) or a detailed teaching and/or research/artistic program (for university teachers, researchers, and artists).
Other_Requirements: Applicants must be admitted or invited to a Slovak host institution for a short-term academic, research, teaching, or artistic stay. International applicants should not have previously studied for a full degree in Slovakia. Ineligible Field: Business Administration. Minimum SAT score of 1100 is also mentioned as a qualification criterion for selection.
Scholarship_Info: The National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic (NSP) is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship initiative established in 2005 by the Government of the Slovak Republic. It aims to support the mobility of international students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers, and artists for short-term academic, research, teaching, or artistic stays at higher education institutions and research organizations within Slovakia.
Application_Documents:
1. Online application form
2. Curriculum Vitae (CV)
3. Motivation Letter
4. Detailed study program (for students) or a detailed teaching and/or research/artistic program (for university teachers, researchers, and artists)
5. Two recommendation letters from professors or supervisors
6. Confirmation of current enrollment (for students and PhD candidates)
7. Academic transcripts and degree certificates
8. English (or Slovak) proficiency certificates (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS)
9. List of publications/artistic activities (specifically for PhD students)
10. Original documents with official translations into Slovak or English if the originals are in another language.
Timeline:
April 30 : Application Deadline for subsequent academic year
October 30/31 : Application Deadline for summer semester
1-2 semesters : Typical stay duration for students
1-10 months : Typical stay duration for PhD students

Scholarship_Name: Azerbaijan Government Scholarship (Educational Grant for OIC/NAM)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Full tuition fees for the chosen program.
Annual round-trip international airfare, facilitating travel to and from Azerbaijan.
A monthly stipend of 800 AZN (approximately 470 USD), intended to cover living expenses.
Comprehensive medical insurance.
Costs associated with visa application and registration in Azerbaijan.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be international students who are citizens of OIC or NAM member countries. They must not be citizens of, or have terminated citizenship from, the Republic of Azerbaijan. Official nomination by the applicant's respective government authorities (Ministry of Foreign Affairs or Education) in the first stage of the application process is a critical requirement. Only nominated candidates will proceed to the second stage of online application via SIACAS. Applicants must possess the required academic background for the chosen level of study. Applicants with foreign qualifications are required to have their documents equated by relevant national bodies (e.g., UNEB for undergraduate, NCHE for postgraduate in Uganda).
Eligible_Fields: Engineering, Public Health, International Relations, Medicine
Eligible_Field_Group: Engineering & Technology, Healthcare & Medicine, Law & Public Policy, Humanities & Social Sciences
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: Minimum 2 years of work experience for Master's applicants
Language_Certificate: English (IELTS: Minimum 5.5, TOEFL: Minimum 50 for Master’s/PhD), Russian, Turkish, Azerbaijani
Age: Undergraduate/General Medicine: Under 35; Master's/Graduate: Not over 30; Doctoral (PhD): Not over 40 (on or before application deadline)
Special_Circumstances: Undergraduate students, particularly from Sri Lanka, are advised not to apply for medical-related degree programs in Azerbaijan universities, as these are currently not recognized by the Sri Lanka Medical Council (SLMC). Candidates who receive scholarships are encouraged to select Higher Educational Institutes recognized by their home country's University Grants Commission.
Career_Plan: Research Proposal (mandatory for PhD applicants), Motivation Letter (required from all applicants)
Other_Requirements: Two recommendation letters are required, ideally from academic or professional referees.
Scholarship_Info: The Azerbaijan Government Scholarship, also known as the Heydar Aliyev—International Education Grant Program, is a distinguished initiative offering fully funded opportunities for international students from OIC/NAM member countries. Its primary goal is to attract talented individuals for university studies and research across preparatory, undergraduate, master’s, doctoral, general medicine, and residency programs at Azerbaijan's leading universities. The program underscores Azerbaijan's commitment to international cooperation and educational development.
Application_Documents:
All Educational Documents (Transcripts & Degrees/Certificates)
Copy of Passport
Medical Certificate
Research Proposal (for PhD applicants)
One-page CV/Resume
Motivation Letter
Completed nomination form (submitted through your country's Ministry of Foreign Affairs or Education)
Two Recommendation Letters

For Ugandan Applicants (additional specific requirements):
Application letter with a recent passport photograph, indicating age, sex, course, home district, telephone contact, and email address.
Photocopies of academic certificates and transcripts.
Timeline:
March 15, 2025 : Official opening date for the first stage of application submission.
March 15 - May 15, 2025 : Submission of applications (first stage) to home country government authorities.
April 30, 2025 : Ugandan Applicants must submit applications to the Ministry of Education and Sports.
May 16 - May 31, 2025 : Review and evaluation of nominated candidates by home country government authorities.
June 1 - June 20, 2025 : Registration of applications (second stage) through the SIACAS online portal (only officially nominated candidates).
June 20 - July 15, 2025 : Further review and evaluation of candidates by Azerbaijani authorities.
July 16 - July 31, 2025 : Notification of selected candidates.
September 15, 2025 : Official start of the academic year.
September 30, 2025 : Last date for selected candidates to arrive in the Republic of Azerbaijan.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The RTP Scholarship is a fully funded scholarship designed to support students pursuing PhD and Master's by Research degrees. It encompasses various forms of financial assistance:
*   RTP Tuition Fee Offsets: These cover the tuition fees for eligible students. All domestic students offered admission to a Masters by Research or doctoral degree at the University of Melbourne, for example, automatically receive a Research Training Program Scholarship (Fee Offset). International candidates of exceptional research potential may also receive RTP International Fee Offset Scholarships.
*   RTP Stipends: These provide a living allowance to support students during their candidature. The living allowance is typically AUD $33,511 per annum (full-time equivalent), paid fortnightly.
*   RTP Allowances: These cover additional costs associated with research training.
*   Relocation Costs: Some universities, such as UniSC, offer up to A$2,000 to assist with relocation costs for RTP Stipend Scholarship recipients undertaking their HDR.
The period of support for an RTP Scholarship is substantial:
*   Research Doctorate: A minimum of 3 years and up to a maximum of 4 years full-time, at the discretion of the HEP. For part-time students, this extends to a minimum of 6 years and up to a maximum of 8 years.
*   Research Masters: A duration of 2 years full-time.
*   Flexibility: The period of support can be increased for approved periods of leave. If a student changes enrolment from a doctoral program to a masters by research program, support is limited to a maximum duration of two years full-time equivalent, including any time already spent in the doctoral program.
Quantity: Not centrally specified, determined by individual universities based on funding and competitive ranking processes.
Eligibility_Criteria: The RTP Scholarship is open to both domestic and international students who are undertaking a Research Doctorate or Research Masters degree (Higher Degree by Research - HDR) at an eligible Australian university. Candidates must be of high quality and demonstrate strong research potential. Applicants can be new to a program or current students (typically enrolled for less than a year full-time equivalent). All RTP Scholarship students must be enrolled (without suspension) in a current HDR course to receive support. Work commitments are generally not accepted as grounds for an extension of the scholarship duration. The scholarship is available to students undertaking Joint Research Awards when an Australian university is the home institution. Applicants may need to be nominated by an enrolling school or institute. Some universities normally offer stipend scholarships subject to enrolment as a full-time, on-campus student for the duration of candidature. Domestic students are eligible for a full RTP Fees Offset if they have not used any RTP Fees Offset or Research Training Scheme funding in the previous three years at any Australian university, or if they have already used such funding and successfully completed an HDR program.
Min_Gpa: Minimum GPA of 6.0/7.0 or equivalent; highly competitive fields often require perfect or near-perfect GPA.
Experience_Years: At least six months of relevant supervised research experience with outstanding results, often gained as part of a Master's degree.
Language_Certificate: English language proficiency requirements vary by institution.
Other_Requirements: Strong referee letters, preferably from academics who have supervised previous research. Confirmation of a qualified supervisor, available space, and necessary resources within the university is a prerequisite. Suitability of the research environment is often a consideration. Applicants are encouraged to highlight achievements that make them stand out, such as authorship of a peer-reviewed journal paper or notable academic prizes and commendations. Academic achievement and/or ethic during the most relevant qualification are also considered.
Scholarship_Info: The Australia Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarship is a prestigious initiative funded by the Australian Government, specifically through the Commonwealth Department of Education and Training. Its primary purpose is to provide financial support to high-quality higher degree by research (HDR) candidates, both domestic and international, undertaking Research Doctorate and Research Masters degrees at eligible Australian universities. The program is administered by individual Higher Education Providers (HEPs).
Application_Documents: Required documents will be specified on the chosen university's 'How to Apply' webpage. Many universities automatically consider eligible applicants for scholarships when they apply for course admission, but some may require a separate scholarship application form (e.g., an 'online graduate research application for Scholarship Only' for current students or those with an offer). Strong referee letters are crucial. Confirmation of a qualified supervisor is a prerequisite.
Timeline:
Application periods and deadlines for RTP scholarships vary significantly by university, typically occurring once or twice a year. Applicants must consult their target university for precise dates.
August 31 (annual) : ANU Round 1 application deadline for international students
2025-09-01 : Federation University 2026 RTP stipend scholarships open
31st of unspecified month (likely Sept/Oct) : Federation University 2026 RTP stipend scholarships close
January-March (following year) : Round 1 commencements

Funding_Details:
The Beijing Government Scholarship primarily covers tuition fees, either fully or partially. It is important to note that the scholarship needs to be applied for annually.
Covered Expenses: Tuition fees.
Funding Details: The scholarship can be full or partial. For partial scholarships, it may cover half or a quarter of the tuition fee for one academic year.
Nature of Scholarship: While some sources may refer to it as "fully funded," official information from Beijing Municipal Government and participating universities clarifies that it covers tuition fees fully or partially.
Quantity: Not specified, as the number of awards is subject to allocation by individual universities.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students pursuing Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctoral Degrees at Chinese universities and colleges located in the Beijing region. Scholarship duration should be under 4 years (typically 2-3 years for Master's, not exceeding 4 years). Applicants must already be admitted as a graduate student (Master's or PhD) at a Beijing university. The previous degree (Bachelor's for Master's applicants) should preferably be from a prestigious university or research institution in the applicant's home country. Excellent current international students studying for degrees (undergraduates, masters, and PhD students) at Beijing Normal University (and likely other participating universities) are also eligible to apply, based on their examination results and academic achievements.
Experience_Years: Not generally required; specific Master's programs (e.g., IMBA at UIBE) may require three years or more of work experience.
Language_Certificate: For English-Taught Majors: IELTS score of 6.0, TOEFL score of 75 or above, or equivalent proof. Applicants from countries where English is the official language are generally exempt. For Chinese-Taught Postgraduate Programs: HSK-5 level or above. Students applying for English-taught programs are not required to submit Chinese proficiency test scores.
Age: No general age limit for Master's applicants; under 25 for undergraduate programs.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must not be receiving any other tuition scholarship funds concurrently with the BGS.
Scholarship_Info: Established by the Beijing Municipal Government, the BGS aims to encourage and support outstanding international students to pursue higher education and conduct research within the capital city's universities and colleges.
Application_Documents: Application Form for Beijing Government Scholarship
Timeline:
February 1st of each year : Application Opening Date
May 30th of each year : Application Deadline
Approximately three months before commencement of studies : Notification of successful candidates (Scholarship Admission Notice, Admission Notice, JW201 received)
